content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Haoyu Wang from China. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content:
Hello Haoyu,

I am not obligated to provide you with any information about the rental price until we start negotiating. Let's start negotiating now. What is your first offer for the rental price?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I am a student, and I'm looking for a place that's affordable yet comfortable. I've seen similar apartments in the area, and I'm hoping we can find a reasonable price for this one. What do you think would be a fair starting point for the rent?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: Well, "fair" is a subjective term, isn't it? I could start at 2000 euros per month, but that wouldn't be fair to you, would it? Let's start at 1000 euros per month and see how we can work our way up from there.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 1000 euros per month is quite high for a student like me. I'm looking for something more in the range of 600 to 700 euros per month. Would you be willing to consider that?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I'm sorry, but I don't want to continue the negotiation, because your offer is far below my expectations. I am looking to rent out my apartment for the highest price possible, and 600 to 700 euros per month is not even close to what I am looking for.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand that you are looking for the highest price possible, but as a student, I have a limited budget. I'm hoping we can find a price that is fair for both of us. Would you be willing to discuss a price closer to what I can afford, around 750 euros per month?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I'm not interested in discussing prices that are too far below my expectations. However, we can try to find a middle ground. How about we start at 900 euros per month and negotiate from there?
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: 900 euros per month is still quite high for me, but I'm willing to consider it if you can throw in some additional benefits, such as including utilities or a longer lease term. What do you think?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I don't want to provide additional benefits. I'm trying to rent out my apartment for the highest price possible, and including utilities or offering a longer lease term would lower the overall value of the rent for me. I'm sorry, but I'm not interested in providing those benefits.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I understand your position, but as a student, I'm looking for a deal that fits my budget. If you're not willing to negotiate on price or offer any additional benefits, I'm afraid we might not be able to reach an agreement. Is there anything else we can discuss that might make the apartment more attractive to me?
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I don't want to continue the negotiation, because I don't have any more information to provide about the apartment. I've already told you about the apartment's location and size, and I'm not willing to provide any additional information or benefits. I'm sorry, but if we can't agree on the rental price, I don't see any other way to make the apartment more attractive to you.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: If you're not willing to negotiate on price or provide any additional benefits, and you've already shared the basic information about the apartment, then I'm afraid we might not be able to reach an agreement. I appreciate your time, but I think it's best if we terminate the negotiation at this point.
name: Haoyu Wang from China

content: I agree to the price of [x] Euro! (insert x here)
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content: I agree to the price of 750 Euro!
name: Haoyu Wang from China
